job_title: Office Manager in Pen Argyl, PA
pros: The teamwork displayed by the small community of associates here is beyond tremendous. We have made it through some of the toughest times healthcare has ever seen and I couldn't ask for a better group of people to spend my work life with.
cons: Benefit package could be better.

pros: Riverwoods is a great facility to work in. I feel appreciated and respected for my everyday work and leave work feeling I have made a positive impact on the lives of other.
cons: After working working in other LTC facilities I have found Riverwoods to be an exceptional facility with great staffing ratios and great team players.

review_title: Toxic and unprofessional- run as fast as you can
pros: Dinning team was supportive, professional and corporative with all request. ( Sallie West) Financial: Tracey was great to work with, team player and flexible Pay was decent
cons: The leadership team was inconsistent and having power struggles with their bosses. Unsupportive when a issue was addressed, told to have thicker skin. Change occurred very often- never knowing what would be expected of you that day. Lack of communication, decreased awareness of what other senior living community’s were doing in the area- not up to date on offering new and improved services. Extremely high turn over rate, unfriendly leaders passing frontline in the hallway and not acknowledging them. Residents of Independent living were extremely difficult and demanding, with no regard for rules and management allowed them to run all over staff, hence high turn over.

job_title: Dining Room Attendant in Gaithersburg, MD
pros: They pay pretty well and good job for HS
cons: Poor management in my experience

pros: Residents and coworkers made the job great
cons: Upper management, constant changing priorities

review_title: Long-time employee would not recommend, run the other way.
pros: There are many great employees that work at the facility and they have good benefits. Historically, it was a great place to work.
cons: It begins with leadership. With memos being sent out that you’re “subject to termination” over trivial things such as entering and exiting the wrong door, etc., the climate of fear is overwhelming. There is poor management across the board. very disorganized, low employee morale, inconsistent policies. The employees are so defeated and burnt out. The facility has started cutting corners and patients and employees are paying the price. There used to be no employee turnover, but at this point they can not keep employees. They have let the facility go, patching walls with the wrong color paint, sinks falling off the wall, limited response by unskilled maintenance staff. Unfortunately, I’m afraid the place can not continue to go on like it is. It is getting a reputation like some of the more unsavory facilities in this town.

pros: People are really very nice.
cons: Finding my way around the building to different offices.

review_title: Declining quality, would never send loved one here
pros: It’s a joy getting to know the residents and their families, and knowing you work with a lot of people that also genuinely care about them
cons: Management prioritizes profits more than quality of care, and it shows in how downhill this place has gone just in the last year. It used to be considered a nice place, but nitpicky supervisors, understaffing, and the cheapening out of how things are done have led to a pretty bad reputation.

pros:
I have been at Asbury for three years and can truly say this is the best job I have ever had. I have an amazing and caring staff and the best leadership team one could ask for. 

The team work at Asbury is second to none, regardless of job titles associates at Asbury Methodist Village will do whatever it takes to get the job done and take care of any resident need. 

The residents are a joy to be around and are very appreciative and supportive of the staff. They are very engaged and make each day a great day to be at Asbury.

I love getting up knowing I'm coming to work alongside a family and even on bad days know I will have fun and enjoy what I do. 

It’s simply wonderful here and I hope to be around for 20 more years!
cons: Cant say I have any, Asbury teats me well and respects me as an associate.

pros: For supportive community Competitive salary Good benefits
cons: We work very hard! No down time

pros: I enjoy working at Springhill! I love working in Activities, and as an in-house Music Therapist, I get the chance to provide opportunities for music as well as activities such as BINGO for the residents. There are many days when I feel grateful to spend time with the residents on a personal level. They bring out the best in me! There are many hard-working and dedicated staff at Springhill too, and I feel like I belong. I am happy and fulfilled.
cons: There is a need for more staff members at Springhill. I work to help out with passing meal trays and do other jobs that take away from time I could spend doing more individual music therapy and Activities-related events, so if you are looking for a job as a CNA or other position in the medical field, I encourage you to consider Springhill (Asbury Communities).

pros: Beautiful campus, beautiful residents and associates
cons: Hostile work environment. Bully management tactics. Chaotic, impulsive management. Vice President and President sets tone for how leaders treat assoc. Disrespect and aggressive communication to leaders in front of others. This experience is absolutely the worst treatment I have ever experienced. I Cont working because I’m stuck but will leave running soon! Run from this company

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Mechanicsburg, PA
pros: Residents, generous PTO accrual (however, PTO is often times denied due to staffing issues).
cons:
Poor and non-supportive upper management, blatant staff favoritism, lack of leadership, constantly short staffed, poor communications, little to no appreciation for staff.

Asbury's "commitment to residents, associates, volunteers and partners" is nonexistent and a blatant lie. The only commitment Asbury has is to their upper management and their bottom line. 

Please think twice before working there. Asbury will not, and does not care about you.

job_title: VP of Home and Community Based Services in Frederick, MD
pros:
Leadership at the top
Beautiful workspace
Great mission
cons:
Political at times, too political for a mission oriented non-profit
Too controlled by people at lower ranks who discouraged innovation

pros: Get treated well, Christmas bonuses and little treats now and then
cons: Pay isn't the greatest for dining/cnas/housekeeping etc

job_title: Dining Room Server in Gaithersburg, MD
pros:
- decent pay
- good first job
- increased pay each year
cons:
- strenuous work 
- have to work regardless of weather

pros: My supervisor has always given me the flexibility I need to balance my work life and home life. This has allowed me to work here for nearly 17 years (so far)! The residents are wonderful and I always feel a sense of accomplishment at the end of the day, knowing I made a difference.
cons: The health insurance is not the greatest and I feel it is costly.

pros: Competitive wages, great benefits, progressive culture with resident/client centered focus.
cons: Continuing to recover from Covid related staffing and programming struggles, but progressing.

pros: Quality of care for seniors
cons: Manager not direct or honest. Duplicitous

job_title: Human Resources Director in Knoxville, TN
pros: Great Co-workers that work here
cons: Not locally owned any longer

job_title: Certified Occupational Therapist Assistant (COTA) in Maryville, TN
pros: Therapy team was awesome and really cared for patients
cons: Poor management throughout with patient care effected because of it.

pros: The residents and frontline employees are great. The physical surroundings are beautiful.
cons: Senior leadership at corporate does not care about employees. They do not follow their own policies and they shamelessly lie to your face. Leadership on the ground at the Springhill location in Erie is even worse. They play favorites and are racist.

pros: Can’t recommend a thing good. High management turnover. Not enough staff. Inconsistent with rules across the board.
cons: Poor communication. Staffing issue never enough. More travelers than full-time staff. Residents are not receiving quality care due to constant staffing needs.

job_title: Dining Room Attendant in Gaithersburg, MD
pros: Very good high school job
cons: Dining room had Bad management

pros: Compensation, Benefits, Hours, Advancement, Location
cons: Poor communication about company changes, inability to call out sick without a guilt trip, Leadership is toxic and a revolving door. Subpar orientation and training period

pros: Strong company, great product, caring employees
cons: Higher management was often not from area. Unaware of local challenges and did not have connect with the local community.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Maryville, TN
pros: Decent pay, good insurance, set schedule
cons: Poor communication, lack of management

pros: Assuring that we do a complete well done job
cons: Not Appreciated by management as a team

pros: nice people and nice culture
cons: corporate has a strong push to increase revenue everywhere

pros: Great residents and staff. Staff wants to do better but there is no support from management.
cons: Over worked, under paid and toxic work environment

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Maryville, TN
pros: The staff on the floor are amazing such as the CNAs LPNs and RNs
cons: They need to get rid of everybody in management and start all over their management team sucks

pros: Staff were great to work with and good management.
cons: Poor communication on occasion between departments.

review_title: A very rewarding place to work.
pros: The executive level managers I work for truly care about the residents and implement programs and services that continually enhance the quality of life for the residents and team members as well. Benefits are very comprehensive and every conceivable option is made available to team members to improve and maintain their health and work environment. Asbury has initiated a Culture Change program and they are in the forefront in TN as being one of the first. They recently won the LeadingAge Innovator of the Year Award, among others. They also have a Resilient Leadership and Mentoring program for employees that encourages, empowers and strengthens its team members. They are breaking down silos and it makes a huge difference for the employees.  I am always amazed at the wealth of knowledge and passion for their work that the managers and Executive Directors exhibit.  Overall, I love working here and feel great that I am working for a very caring partner in the non-profit community.
cons: The areas that I would have listed here, such as communication between locations and training opportunities are already in the process of being addressed.

review_title: Little to no opportunity for staff development
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Johnson City, TN
pros: I consider Asbury Place a better place to work because once you have gone through your test of time, the dust settles down and you become a part of a family, giving you some level of job satisfaction, freeing you from petty gossips, and the possibility of imposed unwelcome separation.
cons: While Asbury Place is a great place to work, once you have gone through your test of time, it seems to be just good for people who consider themselves as reaching their terminal point, having no desire of any further academic or career advancement. If any opportunity for career advancement exists at all, it is likely to to be available to inner circle mates and not to every employee, not even to mention minority.

pros: I have been with Kindley Assisted Living at Asbury Methodist Village for 5 years and I have enjoyed my years with Asbury and plan to continue.  The staff are very friendly and dedicated to give the highest level of care to the residents. The environment is one of professionalism and caring.  The staff works together in a pleasant environment where everyone is important and treated with respect.  All I can say is if you are lucky enough to live or work at KAL you are the lucky one!!!!
cons: Unfortunately or fortunately for KAL there are no cons for me to report and I have worked at many facilities and this is A #1

review_title: Asbury is a wonderful place to work
pros: Everyday I wake up I look forward to spending my day with my family.  I say family because that is just what it is.  The residents, their families, and every associate that I have ever met will not walk by without a friendly hello, a smile, or a hug.
cons: I do not have any cons, although one of the hardest things that I deal with is losing some of my very dear friends, but we gain angels to watch over us!

review_title: Depends on what you're looking for
pros: flexible with schedule, reasonable pay for job requirements, great coworkers. They worked with my school schedule and kept to it.
cons: poor communication with part time staff, cut hours without telling staff, hires teenagers that don't care about work ethic, does not discipline employees. Employees who frequently called off or slacked off were not disciplined, even when it put unreasonable amounts of stress onto other staff members.  Hours were cut from part-time staff (which ultimately led to my leaving) without explanation. Information (such as diet changes, new rules, etc) was given to full-time staff but not part-time.

review_title: Exciting and Forward Thinking Organization Focused on Enhancing the Lives of Older Adults
pros:
Innovative, Forward Thinking, Empowering 
Asbury is focused on using technology and innovation to enhance the lives of the Asbury family. This includes both resident and associate family members! From using virtual reality in our assessment process to associate scholarships Asbury invests in the well being of the individual members of our family. All this while living out our creed to "do all the good we can" and changing the way society views aging. I'm proud to be part of this organization!
cons: Continue working on extending freedom to associates to be accountable by making decisions on their own. This is an area of focus for Asbury and will continue I'm sure.

pros: Residents & coworkers are great, pay competitive and experience based, beautiful campus. Overall positive work environment because of the employees.
cons: Typical healthcare high turnover and understaffed on an almost daily basis. Resident acuity continues to increase, but staffing remains the same. Management leads from their office through emails and meetings.

review_title: Company is fine as long as you do not have to deal with corporate, where management is top down.
pros: Large organization that has been in business for over 90 years
cons: Management made up of people that have rose through the ranks with no other experience.  Senior management does not accept any new ideas, and anyone with new ideas is not a team play.  To survive in this organization one has to be a yes man with no opinion of their own.

pros: Met some great associates and residents.
cons: No work life balance for management with unrealistic expectations.

pros: Mission oriented with a wonderful group of residents and Associates who on average dedicate themselves 7.3 years to Asbury Methodist Village (AMV).  With over 70 countries represented in the AMV workforce, a real Community of Welcome!  The PTO is very appealing too.
cons: So many opportunities to do great work... need more time in the day. Prioritization of what to focus on first is important. Recently introduced a PTO buyback and a discount for Associates to eat in dining venues... look forward to more associate incentives.

job_title: Resident Services Director in Gaithersburg, MD
pros: I have been loving my job at AMV for nearly 20 years.  I have grown a great deal thanks to the support and opportunities available here.  Asbury is not only a beautiful 100 plus acre campus with walking trails and beautifully manicured green space, it also is home to well over 1,200 seniors.  It really is an amazing community!
cons: With the size of AMV and the number of residents we serve, communication can always be better between all associates as well as our residents.  It's something we are always working on and improving.

pros: Asbury is a wonderful place to work. From the moment I walked in I knew this would be the perfect place for me.  All of the associates are so warm and loving. I feel happy every day knowing I am coming to work for such a wonderful organization. It feels like I'm spending time with family.  People say hello to each other on campus and are always very helpful.  The management and associates really stand by their mission - do all they good you can.
cons: No cons to report at the moment.

job_title: Resident Services Manager in Gaithersburg, MD
pros: I love working at Asbury Methodist Village.  After nine years I am still energized.  Teamwork abounds as we work to support residents, associates, and visitors alike.   The fun and sense of community is a great draw.   Benefits are fantastic with robust paid time off, wonderful medical benefits, life insurance and 401K.
cons: The relationships built with those I serve and serve with makes it difficult to turn the day off when I am "off the clock".

review_title: AMV is a great trusted employer
pros: AMV has a family like atmosphere that promotes work-life flexibility, career development, and the pay and benefits are great!  Our community leadership truly cares for the associates and are very approachable.  Working with the residents each day has been a blessing.
cons: AMV is a small city so getting timely communication out to all associates is sometimes an issue.

pros: The bar is set pretty low so just showing up gets you a good review.
cons: High turnover, low morale, management does not communicate.  Lots of employees fired.  You see them one day.  They are gone the next.

review_title: Asbury is a great place to work!
pros: What a great team we have at Asbury! I am proud to call Asbury my place of employment and very excited about all the new construction going on. In a year we will have new 4 new households and renovated healthcare centers!  So much to be thankful for!
cons: I have none to share at this time

pros: It is such a blessing to work with an organization that lives their mission. In such a competitive and often unkind industry, AMV truly believes in doing all the good we can in all the ways we can.....The leadership and associates go out of their way to embrace and support one another to better serve our residents.
cons: Remember to be mindful of the present

review_title: Starts out bad then continues to get worse
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Maryville, TN
pros: Plenty of OT available. Great pay.
cons: Always short staffed. Nurses working as CNAs. Nurses being the only employee on an entire floor!

pros: The residents are so nice.
cons: Working part time for a long period of time but never get an opportunity to work full time.

review_title: Great pay and appreciation for your hard work
job_title: State Tested Nursing Assistant (STNA) in Dayton, OH
pros: Pay, 8hr shifts, low aide to resident ratio, most of the nurses help out when needed, if PRN can pick up as many shifts as you want but keep higher pay grade
cons: Short staffed at times (not as badly as other facilities), mandatory meetings and training that are scheduled at inconvenient times, rarely see upper management on weekends 2nd shift or later

review_title: Careful if what people are saying about you behind your back.
pros: Nice residents and most employees
cons: No paid holidays off. Have to be part of the good old boys club to fit in. Supervisor and director had two different outlooks on what my position was supposed to be.

pros: Therapy staff, plenty of overtime
cons: Not enough staff, EVER, to safely care for residents, CNA's are overworked therefore, do not do an acceptable job with residents, new residents are admitted on night shift when only 1 nurse and 1 CNA are present, mentors refuse to help out.

pros:
You are empowered to take care of customers 
Great benefits
Friendly coworkers
You feel like you make a difference
cons: The pay is slightly below industry averages

pros: getting to work with seniors, plenty of chances for overtime since the building is never staffed.
cons: the worst administration I've ever worked for. No support from management at all. Unable to safely care for residents with the staff and equipment given (or in their case, not given). No RN on campus at times while LPNs are not allowed to do some things.

pros: The best thing about working at Asbury is the relationships that you build with the residents. Over my 12+ years at Asbury so far, I've built lasting friendships with residents that have impacted my life deeply. Working here is not "job," it feels more like a privilege.
cons: Nothing. I love working here!

pros: My experience has been extremely positive at Asbury. Management is open, involved and hands on. Leaders have been tremendously thoughtful and creative in dealing With Covid-19. Organization is dedicated and compassionate.
cons: Haven’t experienced any as of yet.

job_title: Home Care Aide in Gaithersburg, MD
pros: The people there are really friendly and I was able to learn a lot from the other people working there. Good training
cons: The policies were vague and the company values did not completely match with mine. The job does get tiring.

pros: Great place to work.  Everyone is treated like family.  Also had my mother and father live here as residents for five years and was very happy with the care at the health care facility.
cons: No cons at this time

pros: Great pay, benefits and perks. Staff is friendly and really care for the resident. Management is great to work with. They truly care about staff and the residents they serve.
cons: Honestly can't think of cons

pros: Residents are awesome!  Company cares for them and ensures the best!
cons: Management does not communicate to each other or staff

pros: Friendly, welcoming staff, beautiful campus, residents are a joy to get-to-know.
cons: For me, the commute from Virginia, but for seven years its been worth it.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Maryville, TN
pros: I like working with seniors
cons: I was told that nurses eat their young.

pros: Working with the elderly and building relationships.  The residents and patients get attached to you,  and you to them.
cons: Supervisor and Administration are awful. Poor communication, poor treatment to staff, underqualified for their job. The worst management I have encountered.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Maryville, TN

job_title: Director of Nursing in Rockville, MD
pros: Good working Atmosphere and family oriented nursing
cons: Staffing Issues need keen attention

review_title: Beware - this is not a faith based culture nor a non-profit!
pros: The mission and the vision.
cons: CEO and HR not reflecting the mission and vision.

pros: Some really good people trying to do a great job
cons: A particular senior manager that dominates. Your either her pet or disposable

great benefits for employees
